oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PROBABILISTIC CALCULATION MODEL OF DIRECTIONAL RANDOM WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pae, Wi-Gwang
Mase, Hajime
Sakai, Tetsuo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: random wave
probabilistic calculation model
directional wave
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A probabilistic calculation model is developed, for the simplicity of inclusion of wave breaking and energy dissipation, to predict the transformation of directionally-spreading random waves by using parabolic refraction-diffraction equations. The numerical predictions are compared with the experimental observations of random wave transformation over an elliptic shoal by Vincent and Briggs (1989); the predictions agree well with the observations under the non-breaking condition, however, the agreement is poor under the wave breaking condition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
